turns.speaker: DICK
turns.text: I got the diamond.  Quell problemo, Bruce?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: You left your back wide open.  Freeze could have killed you.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Of course.  Alfred still keeps your mother's picture in his room.

turns.speaker: DICK
turns.text: Anybody want to tell us kids in the cheap seats who Joanna Clark is?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: He's dying.  And I can't deal with it.

turns.speaker: DICK
turns.text: But he's never said a word-

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: You know Alfred.  He'd never say Anything.  But I can tell.  Until you came along, Alfred was the only family I ever had.  Without him, I don't know how I would have survived.  He saved my life, Dick.  And I've never told him.

turns.speaker: DICK
turns.text: Talk to him, Bruce.  There's nothing worse than losing someone without telling them how you feel.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: I'm scared, Dick.  Maybe for the first time in my life.  I'm really scared.

turns.speaker: DICK
turns.text: McGregor's Syndrome.  That's what Freeze's wife had.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Yes.  But Alfred's condition is less severe.  Freeze's research says he cured a case like Alfred's.  It just doesn't say how.

turns.speaker: DICK
turns.text: I checked the medical database.  No one else is even close.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: I'm late for the dedication.  Then I go after Freeze and Ivy.  Alone.

turns.speaker: DICK
turns.text: Like hell you do.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Dick, don't push me right now.

turns.speaker: DICK
turns.text: Or what?  No one can capture Ivy but the big bad Bat.  Crap!  You just want her for yourself.  Don't you?  Answer me, damn it!

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Yes!  Yes, I want her so badly I can taste it.  That's the whole point. Look at us.  Orphans.  Isolated. Obsessed to the exclusion of life, love, family.  We're perfect targets. She's done something to us, got us fighting over her somehow.

turns.speaker: DICK
turns.text: Hail the all-knowing Bruce Wayne. Here's what I know, she loves me, Not you and it's driving you crazy. It's why you stopped us from kissing. Because if you can't have her, nobody can.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: She's clouded your mind.  You're not thinking straight.

turns.speaker: DICK
turns.text: Oh but I am.  For the first time in a long time.  I'm through living in your shadow.  All that ends right now.

turns.speaker: DICK
turns.text: That's no batlight, it's a birdcall.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Her name is Pamela Isley.  I saw her talking to Gordon.  She must have stolen his keys, altered the signal-

turns.speaker: DICK
turns.text: And she did it all for me.  For love.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: She's infected us with some kind of pheromone extract-

turns.speaker: DICK
turns.text: Is that it, Bruce?  I'm under some magic spell?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: She wants to kill you.

turns.speaker: DICK
turns.text: You'd say anything to keep me away from her.  To keep her for yourself.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: You once said to me that being part of a team means trusting your partner.  That sometimes counting on someone else is the only way to win.  DO you remember?

turns.speaker: DICK
turns.text: One question.  When Batgirl and I rolled off the telescope, how come you didn't try and save us? It was the first time I fell and you weren't there to catch me.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: I knew you could handle it.

turns.speaker: FREEZE
turns.text: Let me guess, Plant Girl? Vine Lady? Ms. Moss?

turns.speaker: IVY
turns.text: Listen, Captain Cold, the suit, maybe, even though silver went out in the 70's.  But those boots are unforgivable. What is it with men?

turns.speaker: FREEZE
turns.text: I'd love to stand here all day and exchange fashion tips but I'm kind of pressed for time.  So hand over the diamond, Garden Gal, or I turn you into mulch.

turns.speaker: FREEZE
turns.text: Impressive

turns.speaker: IVY
turns.text: Well, I, my most unabominable snowman, have been impressed by you. In fact I propose a pairing.  So I'm here to set you free.

turns.speaker: FREEZE
turns.text: An enticing offer.  But what does the lady want in return?

turns.speaker: IVY
turns.text: Let's cool it for now.  There's someone I want you to meet.

turns.speaker: IVY
turns.text: I love that belt.  What are you, about a fifty Big and Tall?

turns.speaker: FREEZE
turns.text: I always go a size smaller.  Makes me look slimmer.

turns.speaker: FREEZE
turns.text: No gun.  How disarming.

turns.speaker: IVY
turns.text: I wonder if I can get a cell with a view of the gardens?

turns.speaker: FREEZE
turns.text: Dear daisy, don't despair.

turns.speaker: FREEZE
turns.text: My reserves are exhausted.  I must have the gems that power my suit.

turns.speaker: IVY
turns.text: You are looking unseasonably hot. Let's go inside and grab your rocks.

turns.speaker: FREEZE
turns.text: In my weakened state I am no match for the bat and the bird.

turns.speaker: IVY
turns.text: You leave Batman and Robin to me.

turns.speaker: IVY
turns.text: Trust me.  Vegetable magnetism.

turns.speaker: FREEZE
turns.text: Fine.  While I retrieve my diamonds, you and meatloaf will bring my wife to your lair.  She's frozen in -

turns.speaker: IVY
turns.text: Hold it.  You never said anything about a wife, frozen or otherwise-

turns.speaker: FREEZE
turns.text: You will rescue my wife

turns.speaker: IVY
turns.text: OK, OK.  Ms. Ivy to the rescue.  Now where do I find your brittle bride?

turns.speaker: IVY
turns.text: Make yourself right at home.

turns.speaker: FREEZE
turns.text: Where is my wife?

turns.speaker: IVY
turns.text: There was nothing I could do.  Batman deactivated her.  She's dead.

turns.speaker: FREEZE
turns.text: You lie!

turns.speaker: FREEZE
turns.text: Their bones will turn to ice.  Their blood will freeze in my hands.

turns.speaker: IVY
turns.text: Kill them.  Of course.  But why stop there?  Why should only Batman and Robin die while the society that created them goes unpunished?

turns.speaker: FREEZE
turns.text: Yes.  I shall replay the world for sentencing me to a life without the warmth of human comfort.  I will blanket the city in endless winter. First Gotham and then the world.

turns.speaker: IVY
turns.text: Just what I had in mind.  Everything dead on Earth except us.  A chance for mother nature to start again.  Plants and flowers are the oldest species on the planet yet they are defenseless against man.  Sorry hon, this is for science.  Behold the dawn of a new age.

turns.speaker: IVY
turns.text: I have created a race of plants with the strength of the deadliest animals.  Once you have frozen mankind, my mutants will overrun the globe.  The Earth will become a brave new world of only plants. And we shall rule them.  For we will be the only two people left in the world.

turns.speaker: FREEZE
turns.text: Adam and Evil.

turns.speaker: FREEZE
turns.text: You will distract the bat and bird while I prepare to freeze Gotham.

turns.speaker: IVY
turns.text: Can't we just ice them along with the rest of the citizenry?

turns.speaker: FREEZE
turns.text: That is far too merciful.  Batman will watch his beloved Gotham perish, then I will kill him.

turns.speaker: IVY
turns.text: As a team, the duncely duo protect each other.  But the Robin is young. Impetuous.  If I could get him alone-

turns.speaker: FREEZE
turns.text: One kiss and you could lift the mask from his lifeless face.  Their secret identities would be revealed.  But how best to bait a brid?

turns.speaker: IVY
turns.text: The way to a boy's heart is through his ego.  What strapping young hero could resist his very own...signal?

turns.speaker: FREEZE
turns.text: Inspired, Ms. Ivy.

turns.speaker: IVY
turns.text: I'm hungry.  I think I'll have poultry.

turns.speaker: FREEZE
turns.text: Prepare for a bitter harvest. Winter has come at last.

turns.speaker: IVY
turns.text: Not good.

turns.speaker: MS. B. HAVEN
turns.text: Freezy, I'm feeling...hot.

turns.speaker: FREEZE
turns.text: I find that unlikely.

turns.speaker: MS. B. HAVEN
turns.text: Okay, my hair is brittle, my skin is dry and I don't care.  I'd weather blizzards to have you. You're the most perfect man I've ever known.

turns.speaker: FREEZE
turns.text: To be frozen.  To never change.  A life of perpetual ice-olation. There is little perfection in that.

turns.speaker: MS. B. HAVEN
turns.text: What say we turn up the heat?

turns.speaker: FREEZE
turns.text: You're skating on thin ice.  My passion thaws for my bride alone.

turns.speaker: MS. B. HAVEN
turns.text: Forget your frosty femme.  These lips are wet and ready to get frostbite.

turns.speaker: FREEZE
turns.text: Hop away little bunny.  Before I cool your jets.  Permanently.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: Give it up.  If you threw yourself-

turns.speaker: IVY
turns.text: At you?  Polly want a kiss?

turns.speaker: IVY
turns.text: I'm glad you came.  I can't breathe without you.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: I want us to be together.  But I need to know you're serious about turning over a new leaf.  I need a sign.

turns.speaker: IVY
turns.text: How about dangerous curves?

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: Of trust. Tell me your plan.

turns.speaker: IVY
turns.text: Kiss me and I'll tell you.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: Tell me and I'll kiss you.

turns.speaker: IVY
turns.text: Freeze has turned the new telescope into a freezing gun.  He's about to turn Gotham into an ice cube.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: I've got to stop him.

turns.speaker: IVY
turns.text: One kiss, my love.  For luck.

turns.speaker: IVY
turns.text: Bad luck, I'm afraid.  It's time to die, little bird.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: What do you mean?

turns.speaker: IVY
turns.text: You should have heeded your pointy- eared pal.  These lips can be murder.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: Then you never loved me?

turns.speaker: IVY
turns.text: Love you?  I loathe your bipedal arrogance, your animal superiority. My only joy is knowing that even now my poison kiss is sucking the life from your ape-like face.

turns.speaker: IVY
turns.text: You're too late.  Say bye-bye birdie.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: Sorry to disappoint you.  But rubber lips are immune to your charms.

turns.speaker: WOODRUE
turns.text: What do we have here?  A lovely new supply of Venom.  I'll just take this to my laboratory for further study.

turns.speaker: PAMELA
turns.text: What exactly are you working on in there?  What are those screams?

turns.speaker: PAMELA
turns.text: You have to tell me what you're doing with my Venom.

turns.speaker: WOODRUE
turns.text: You must show me your secrets, blossom, before I show you mine.

turns.speaker: WOODRUE
turns.text: ...Our original sponsor had no stomach for military applications. he cut the funding for our work -

turns.speaker: PAMELA
turns.text: Our work?

turns.speaker: WOODRUE
turns.text: Without your research, I could never have come this far.  Join me.  The two of us, entwined, side by side...

turns.speaker: PAMELA
turns.text: Join you?  I've spent my life trying to protect plants from extinction and now you corrupt my research into some maniacal scheme for world domination. When I get through you won't be able to get a job teaching high school chemistry, do you hear me, you psycho?

turns.speaker: WOODRUE
turns.text: Well, I can respect your opinion.

turns.speaker: WOODRUE
turns.text: Dr. Isley?  Pamela?  You look great. Especially for a dead woman.

turns.speaker: PAMELA
turns.text: Hello, Jason.  I think I've had a change of heart.

turns.speaker: ALFRED
turns.text: The dreams again, sir?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: I think they're getting worse.

turns.speaker: ALFRED
turns.text: It's a wonder you sleep at all.

turns.speaker: ALFRED
turns.text: ...Would it be a terrible imposition to ask you to take better care of your equipment?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Then you'd have nothing to complain about.

turns.speaker: ALFRED
turns.text: Hardly a worry, sir.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: How's the sonar coming, Alfred?

turns.speaker: ALFRED
turns.text: A few hitches sir, but I'm confident we'll have a prototype in no time.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: It'll never work.

turns.speaker: ALFRED
turns.text: I believe you said the same thing about the Batmobile.

turns.speaker: ALFRED
turns.text: Scholarly research?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: She has an excellent mind.

turns.speaker: ALFRED
turns.text: If I misinterpreted your interest in the lady, I humbly apologize--

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: I wonder if she'd go out with me.

turns.speaker: ALFRED
turns.text: Apology hastily retracted.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Do you remember the night I fell into that cave and the bat chased me?

turns.speaker: ALFRED
turns.text: Your parents' wake. Rain fell like tears.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: ...The night Batman was born.  What was I doing in the fields that night, Alfred? What sent me running out into that storm? I keep dreaming about it but I just can't remember.

turns.speaker: ALFRED
turns.text: I don't know, sir. Your dear parents.  Suddenly gone. So much loss...

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: I remember the bat, though. His scream. Those eyes. i was sure the fear would kill me.  In time I came to believe that if I became a monster, that if I was feared, I wouldn't be scared anymore. I was wrong.  They think I became Batman to fight crime. I became Batman to fight the fear. And instead I became the fear.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Gee, I'm not sure.  Alfred? How many rooms? Total?

turns.speaker: ALFRED
turns.text: Ninety-three, including the sauna.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Take any three you like. After you get settled we can...

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: It's happening again. Just like my parents. A monster comes out of the night. A scream. Two gunshots. I killed them.

turns.speaker: ALFRED
turns.text: What did you say?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: He killed them. Two-Face. He slaughtered that boy's parents.

turns.speaker: ALFRED
turns.text: No. You said I. I killed them.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Don't be ridiculous.

turns.speaker: ALFRED
turns.text: Sorry to bother you, sir. I have some rather distressing news about Master Dick.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Is he all right?

turns.speaker: ALFRED
turns.text: I'm afraid Master Dick has... gone traveling.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: He ran away?

turns.speaker: ALFRED
turns.text: Actually, he took the car.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: He boosted the Jag?  Is that all?

turns.speaker: ALFRED
turns.text: Not the Jaguar. The _other_ car.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: The _Rolls_?

turns.speaker: ALFRED
turns.text: _No_, sir. _The_ _other_ _car_!

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Too much wealth. Too fast. Half of Gotham zombied-out. A technology that self destructs. He's protecting more than industrial secrets, Alfred.

turns.speaker: ALFRED
turns.text: I shall be near at hand. Should you need me. And sir, I know it's difficult but try and have a good time.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Maybe they're right.

turns.speaker: ALFRED
turns.text: Which `they' might that be, sir?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Jack Napier's dead. My parents are avenged. The Wayne Foundation contributes a small fortune to police and crime prevention programs.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Why do I keep doing this?

turns.speaker: ALFRED
turns.text: Why, indeed?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Could I let Batman go? For Dick. For me. Could I leave the shadows? Have a life. Friends. Family...

turns.speaker: ALFRED
turns.text: Dr. Meridian...

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: She's the first woman in a long time that's... No. She's the first woman ever. And she loves Batman. Not Bruce Wayne. If I let go of Batman I'll lose her.

turns.speaker: ALFRED
turns.text: Perhaps. Perhaps not. Why not ask the lady?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: How? As Batman, knowing she wants me? Or as Bruce Wayne and hope...?

turns.speaker: ALFRED
turns.text: How are you feeling, young man?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Not that young. It's been a long time since you've called me that.

turns.speaker: ALFRED
turns.text: Old habits die hard. Are you alright?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: As well as can be expected, I guess. Give me the bad news.

turns.speaker: ALFRED
turns.text: Dick has run away. They have taken Dr. Meridian. And I'm afraid they found the cave, sir. It's been destroyed.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: I'm Batman? I remember my life as Bruce Wayne.  But all this. It's like the life of a stranger.

turns.speaker: ALFRED
turns.text: Perhaps the fall...

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: There's one other thing. I feel..

turns.speaker: ALFRED
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: ...Afraid.

turns.speaker: ALFRED
turns.text: Bruce. Son. Listen to me. You are a kind man. A strong man. But in truth you are not the most sane man.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: ...A bat.

turns.speaker: ALFRED
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: I remember a bat. A monster. A demon. Chasing me.  Oh my God, Alfred.

turns.speaker: ALFRED
turns.text: No demons, son.  Your monsters are here. Until you fact that, I fear you will spend your life fleeing them.

turns.speaker: ALFRED
turns.text: Master, Bruce?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: ...Batman, Alfred. I'm Batman.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: All the answers are numbers.

turns.speaker: ALFRED
turns.text: But 1, 3, 1, 8, & 5. What do they mean?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: What do maniacs always want?

turns.speaker: ALFRED
turns.text: Recognition, of course.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Precisely. So this number is probably some kind of calling card.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Letters in the alphabet.

turns.speaker: ALFRED
turns.text: Of course. 13 is M....MRE.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: How about, MR. E.

turns.speaker: ALFRED
turns.text: Mystery.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: And another name for Mystery?

turns.speaker: ALFRED
turns.text: Enigma.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Exactly. Mr. E. Mister Edward Nygma.

turns.speaker: ALFRED
turns.text: What now sir?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Claw Island. Nygma's headquarters. I'm sure that's where they're keeping Chase.  Are all the Batsuits destroyed?

turns.speaker: ALFRED
turns.text: All except the prototype with the sonar modifications you so disapprove of. But it hasn't yet been tested.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Tonight's a good night.

turns.speaker: ALFRED
turns.text: Welcome, Master Grayson. I'm Alfred.

turns.speaker: DICK
turns.text: How ya doin', Al?

turns.speaker: ALFRED
turns.text: Al?

turns.speaker: DICK
turns.text: Big house. How many rooms?

turns.speaker: ALFRED
turns.text: May I help you, Master Grayson?

turns.speaker: DICK
turns.text: How come this is the only locked door around this museum? What's back there?

turns.speaker: ALFRED
turns.text: Master Wayne's dead wives.

turns.speaker: DICK
turns.text: Up here, Al.

turns.speaker: ALFRED
turns.text: Just checking, young sir.

turns.speaker: DICK
turns.text: Four seconds from...

turns.speaker: CHASE
turns.text: _Two_ million dollars waiting to be transferred from the _Second_ Bank of Gotham on the _22nd_ How could Harvey? _Two_-Face resist?

turns.speaker: BATMAN
turns.text: And you are?

turns.speaker: BATMAN
turns.text: ...dual personalities. Abnormal psychology. Washington's poster child for the criminally insane. I read your work.

turns.speaker: CHASE
turns.text: I'm flattered. Not every girl makes a super-hero's night table.  You might have some interesting insights into Two-Face.

turns.speaker: BATMAN
turns.text: Why's that?

turns.speaker: CHASE
turns.text: Let's just say I could write a hell of a paper on a grown man who dresses like a flying rodent.

turns.speaker: BATMAN
turns.text: Bats aren't rodents, Dr. Meridian.

turns.speaker: CHASE
turns.text: I didn't know that. See? You _are_ interesting. And call me Chase. By the way, do you have a first name? Or do I just call you bats?

turns.speaker: CHASE
turns.text: He's home. I sent the signal.

turns.speaker: BATMAN
turns.text: What's wrong?

turns.speaker: CHASE
turns.text: Last night at the circus. I noticed something about Dent. His coin. He's obsessed with justice. It's his Achilles' heel. It can be exploited.

turns.speaker: CHASE
turns.text: I wish I could say my interest in you was purely professional...

turns.speaker: BATMAN
turns.text: Are you trying to get under my cape, Doctor?

turns.speaker: CHASE
turns.text: A girl cannot live by psychoses alone.

turns.speaker: BATMAN
turns.text: It's the car, right? Chicks love the car.

turns.speaker: CHASE
turns.text: What is it about the wrong kind of man? In grade school it was guys with earrings. College, motorcycles and leather jackets.

turns.speaker: CHASE
turns.text: Now black rubber.

turns.speaker: BATMAN
turns.text: Try a fireman. Less to take off.

turns.speaker: CHASE
turns.text: I don't mind the work. Pity I can't see behind the mask.

turns.speaker: BATMAN
turns.text: We all wear masks.

turns.speaker: CHASE
turns.text: My life's an open book. You read?

turns.speaker: BATMAN
turns.text: I'm not the kind of guy who blends in at a family picnic.

turns.speaker: CHASE
turns.text: We could give it a try. I'll bring the wine, you bring the scarred psyche.

turns.speaker: BATMAN
turns.text: You are direct, aren't you?

turns.speaker: CHASE
turns.text: You like strong women. I've done my homework. Or do I need skin-tight vinyl and a whip?

turns.speaker: BATMAN
turns.text: I haven't had much luck with women...

turns.speaker: CHASE
turns.text: Maybe you just haven't met the right woman...

turns.speaker: BATMAN
turns.text: Help Chase. I'll be back.

turns.speaker: CHASE
turns.text: Did Two-Face call him Bruce?

turns.speaker: RIDDLER
turns.text: Welcome to my parlor said the Riddler to the Bat. How's tricks?

turns.speaker: BATMAN
turns.text: No more tricks, Edward. Release Chase and Dick. This is between you and me.

turns.speaker: BATMAN
turns.text: Death.  Death. Without taste, sound and all around us.  Because there is no way for me to save them or myself. This is one giant death trap.

turns.speaker: RIDDLER
turns.text: Excellent. See. Who says a guy in a rubber suit can't be smart? Well, it's been grand. Sorry you all have to die now.

turns.speaker: BATMAN
turns.text: Wait. I have a riddle for you.

turns.speaker: RIDDLER
turns.text: For _me_? Really? Tell me.

turns.speaker: BATMAN
turns.text: I see without seeing. To me, darkness is as clear as daylight. What am I?

turns.speaker: RIDDLER
turns.text: Oh please. You're blind as a bat.

turns.speaker: BATMAN
turns.text: Exactly!

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Bruce Wayne. In the flesh.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Um...I'm pretty sure I'm Bruce Wayne. And you are?

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Nygma. Edward Nygma. You hired me. Personally. Just like I tell everyone.  Well, we've never actually met, but your name was on the hire slip.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: I'm gonna need that hand back, Ed.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: What? Ah yes. Of course. I'm sorry. It's just that...you're my idol.  And some people have been trying to keep us apart.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Mr. Nygma, you'll forgive me for being rude. But what exactly is on your mind?

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Precisely. What's on all our minds? Brainwaves. The future of Wayne Enterprises is Brainwaves!

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Call my secretary, she'll set something up.  Factory looks great, folks.  Keep up the good work.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Wait. You can't go.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: We'll talk some other -

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: No. Don't leave me! My invention! I need you!

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: So glad you could come.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: What? Oh, Edward. Hi. Congratulations. Great party-

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: The press were just wondering what it feels like to be outsold, outclassed, and generally outdone in every way...  And what light through yonder window breaks? `Tis the east. And you are...

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: What? Oh, it's very impressive.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Gracious even in defeat. How vaguely disappointing. When all this could have been ours together.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: No grape could be more intoxicating than you, my dear. But we make due. To your charms.  Skol.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Nostrovia.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: La'chiem.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Slanta.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Rinka.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Banzai.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: I notice you've sub-divided your B coupons. Feeling a little light on principle?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Actually, I like to divest just before a major re-capitalization.

turns.speaker: CHASE
turns.text: How can I help you, Mr. Wayne?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Somebody's been sending me love letters. Commissioner Gordon thought you might give me your expert opinion.

turns.speaker: CHASE
turns.text: Psychiatrists make you nervous?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Just ones this beautiful.

turns.speaker: CHASE
turns.text: The infamous Wayne charm. Does it ever shut off?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: On occasion. Usually at night.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Still play with dolls, Doctor?

turns.speaker: CHASE
turns.text: She's a Malaysian dream warden. She stands sentry while you sleep and calms your dreams.  Need one?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Me? No. Only things that need calming in my dreams are the Rockettes.

turns.speaker: CHASE
turns.text: My opinion. This letter writer is a total wacko.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Wacko? That a technical term?

turns.speaker: CHASE
turns.text: Patient apparently suffers from acute obsessional syndrome with potential homicidal styles. Work better for you?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: So what you're saying, this guy's a total wacko, right?

turns.speaker: CHASE
turns.text: Exactly.

turns.speaker: CHASE
turns.text: I think the question would be, do you have a thing for bats?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: So, this Riddler, he's dangerous?

turns.speaker: CHASE
turns.text: What do you know about obsession?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Not much.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: It's a stretch but I'll manage.

turns.speaker: CHASE
turns.text: The letter writer is obsessed with you. His only escape may be...

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: To kill me.

turns.speaker: CHASE
turns.text: You understand obsession better than you let on.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: No insights here, doc. Just trying to get comfortable on your couch.  Oops. Times up.

turns.speaker: CHASE
turns.text: That's usually my line.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Look, I'd love to keep chatting-

turns.speaker: CHASE
turns.text: Would you? I'm not so sure.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: But I'm going to have to get you out of those clothes.

turns.speaker: CHASE
turns.text: Excuse me.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: And into a black dress.

turns.speaker: CHASE
turns.text: I'm surprised you aren't blind by now.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: I'm sorry. Who are you?

turns.speaker: CHASE
turns.text: Like normal folks.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: What? This isn't normal?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: That kid is amazing.

turns.speaker: CHASE
turns.text: I don't get you Bruce Wayne.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Me? I'm easy. Especially after a couple of martinis.

turns.speaker: CHASE
turns.text: The glib, cavalier routine, it really is an act, isn't it?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Don't believe it. I'm just skin deep.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Look, I'm rock climbing Sunday. How about coming along?

turns.speaker: CHASE
turns.text: Bruce, much to my surprise, you seem like a really great guy...

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: But...

turns.speaker: CHASE
turns.text: Well, I met someone...

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Fast work. You just moved here.

turns.speaker: CHASE
turns.text: You could say he kind of dropped out of the sky and bang-. I think he felt it too.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: He sure did.

turns.speaker: CHASE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: I said I'm sure he did.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: The style of the letters I'm getting matches those found at the crime sites. Why would The Riddler be sending me riddles?  Who's your decorator? U-Haul?

turns.speaker: CHASE
turns.text: Sorry. I haven't even had time to unpack. Instant coffee okay?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: A lot of what happened is jagged. Pieces missing. I can't really remember. I just get flashes. Usually in my dreams. I'd kind of gotten used to them. At least accepted them....

turns.speaker: CHASE
turns.text: And now....

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: They've changed. The dreams, I mean. There's a new element I don't understand. A book. Black. Covered in leather....

turns.speaker: CHASE
turns.text: Find anything interesting?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Why do I feel like the other man, here?

turns.speaker: CHASE
turns.text: Come on, Bruce. This is what I do for a living.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: I'd say this goes a little beyond taking your work home.

turns.speaker: CHASE
turns.text: What do you want me to say? That I'm not attracted to him?

turns.speaker: CHASE
turns.text: Why do you do that?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: CHASE
turns.text: Throw up that ridiculous superficial mask. If you're jealous...

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: I'm not-

turns.speaker: CHASE
turns.text: You want me close but you won't let me near. What's the terrible, dark secret you're protecting everyone from?

turns.speaker: CHASE
turns.text: In a sense we are all two people. The side we show in daylight. And that side we keep in shadow.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Rage. Anger. Passion. Pain.

turns.speaker: CHASE
turns.text: If I didn't know better, I'd say you were sulking.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Keep me off the couch, Doc. Your fees are a little rich for me.

turns.speaker: CHASE
turns.text: Touchy, touchy.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: So how goes your `scholarly' pursuit of Batman?

turns.speaker: CHASE
turns.text: Oh God, Bruce. You're still jealous.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Spare me the diagnosis, okay? You're being ridiculous. I can't be jealous of Batman.  Can I?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: And the beast slouches towards Bethelem.

turns.speaker: CHASE
turns.text: Excuse me, boys. I'd hate to stop this testosterone flood on my account-

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: There's something I want to talk with you about. It's...Well, we.. I...

turns.speaker: CHASE
turns.text: Okay, tiger, take it slow. You going to give me your pin or something?

turns.speaker: CHASE
turns.text: Your memories are repressed. They're trying to break through. Relax. Try to remember-.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: I don't want to remember!

turns.speaker: CHASE
turns.text: Stop fighting.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: My parents are laid out in the library. Their skin smells like talcum powder. I'm so small. My father's diary is on his desk like always. I'm opening the book. Reading. I'm running out into the storm. The book is in my hands. I can't hear my screams over the rain. I'm falling...

turns.speaker: CHASE
turns.text: What does it say? What hurts so much, Bruce? What does the book say?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: I don't-.

turns.speaker: CHASE
turns.text: You do know. Try.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: The last entry read, Bruce insists on seeing a movie tonight.  Bruce insists. I made them go out. I made them take me to the movie. To that theater...  It was my fault. I killed them.

turns.speaker: CHASE
turns.text: Oh God, Bruce, you were a child. You weren't responsible.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: ...Not the bat?

turns.speaker: CHASE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: I always thought it was the bat that scared me that night that changed my life. But it wasn't. The real fear was hiding underneath: what I read in the journal, that my parents' deaths were my fault. That's what I couldn't remember. That's the crime I've been paying for all these years.

turns.speaker: CHASE
turns.text: What are you talking about?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Chase. There's something I need to tell you--

turns.speaker: DICK
turns.text: Okay. I'm outta here.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Excuse me.

turns.speaker: DICK
turns.text: I figure telling that cop I'd stay here saved me a truckload of social service interviews and good will. So no offense but thanks. See ya.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Where will you go? The circus is halfway to Metropolis by now.

turns.speaker: DICK
turns.text: I got no place at the circus without my family. I'm going to get a fix on Two-Face. Then I'm going to kill him.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Listen, Dick. Killing Two-Face won't take the pain away. It'll make it worse.

turns.speaker: DICK
turns.text: Look, spare me the sermons, okay. You're just some rich guy who is trying to do a good deed. You don't even know me.

turns.speaker: DICK
turns.text: I need to be part of this.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Absolutely not.

turns.speaker: DICK
turns.text: Me and my brother Chris were putting money aside so our folks could retire. Dad's knee was going. Chris was engaged, you know that? Two-Face took...everything. Now I can pay him back.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: What I do isn't about revenge.

turns.speaker: DICK
turns.text: Back off, man.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: You don't understand. It's an addiction. You fight night after night, trying to fill the emptiness. But the pain's back in the morning. And somewhere along the way it stops being a choice.  I want better for you.

turns.speaker: DICK
turns.text: Save the sermons about how great you want my life to be, okay, Bruce? If it weren't for Batman my parents wouldn't be dead. You don't get it, do you? This is all your fault.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: What the hell did you think you were doing?

turns.speaker: DICK
turns.text: You have a real gratitude problem. You know that, Bruce? I need a name. Batboy? The Dark Earl? What's a good side kick name?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: How about Richard Grayson, college student?

turns.speaker: DICK
turns.text: ...I missed Two-Face by a heartbeat. When we catch him, you gotta let me kill him!

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: We don't kill. Killing is what damns you. It-. What am I talking about? This conversation is over. You're going away to school.

turns.speaker: DICK
turns.text: I saved your life. You owe me. So either you let me be your partner or I'm going after Harvey on my own.

turns.speaker: DICK
turns.text: You can't-.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Dick, let go. Revenge will eat you alive. Trust me. I know.

turns.speaker: DICK
turns.text: But what about all the good we can do? There are monsters out there. Gotham needs us.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: And when you finally get Two-Face?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Exactly. And once you'd killed him you'd be lost. Like me.  All this has to be a choice. Otherwise...it's a curse.

turns.speaker: DICK
turns.text: Bruce, you can't.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Chase is coming for dinner. Why don't you join us.

turns.speaker: CHASE
turns.text: Chase?

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Of course you are. And what a grand pursuit you must be.  What do you think of my new invention?

turns.speaker: CHASE
turns.text: Edward...

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Who is it?

turns.speaker: CHASE
turns.text: It's Dr. Meridian. Chase. Do you remember me?

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: How could I forget?

turns.speaker: CHASE
turns.text: Dr. Burton tells me you know who Batman is.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Yesssssss. I know!

turns.speaker: CHASE
turns.text: Who is The Batman, Edward?

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Can't tell if you don't say please.

turns.speaker: CHASE
turns.text: You're right, Edward. I didn't mean to be impolite. Please.
